;Municipal rubbish heap gas composition is primarily governed by its source from millions of little microbial reactions in the landfill. Solid waste initially decomposes aerobically when the primary gas product is CO2. As the oxygen is utilized up, facultative and anaerobic micro-organisms predominate and these start making methane.
;
;Though dump gas, or methane, isn't without delay dangerous to health, it can explode if permitted to accrue in confined spaces. Capped landfills are particularly at the mercy of methane buildup because these systems block the methane from dispersing into the air thru its ordinary route. Critical situations develop when the trapped methane looks for outlets beyond the rubbish heap bounds, endangering bordering homes and businesses.

;Gases from landfill sites may not only have potential health effects on those folks working at the site, but also on those living in the neighborhood.
